history: The fall of the Western Roman Empire occurred in 476 AD.
Julius Caesar was a key figure in the transition from the Roman Republic to the Roman Empire.
The Pax Romana was a period of relative peace and stability in the Roman Empire.
The city of Rome was founded in 753 BC.
The Roman Republic preceded the Roman Empire.
The Roman Emperor Nero is infamous for his tyrannical rule.
The Eastern Roman Empire, known as the Byzantine Empire, continued until 1453.
The Punic Wars were fought between Rome and Carthage.
The Roman Empire reached its greatest extent under Emperor Trajan.
The Roman Empire was the post-Republican period of ancient Rome.
architecture: The Colosseum in Rome could hold up to 50,000 spectators.
Roman engineering was so advanced that some of their roads and aqueducts are still in use today.
Romans built the aqueduct known as the Pont du Gard in France.
Roman architecture is characterized by the use of arches and domes.
Romans built extensive networks of roads across their empire.
Roman baths included facilities for exercise and socializing.
The Roman Pantheon is a temple dedicated to all the gods.
Romans built triumphal arches to commemorate military victories.
The Circus Maximus was a large chariot racing stadium in Rome.
Romans used aqueducts to transport water over long distances.
culture: Romans practiced polytheism, worshipping multiple gods and goddesses.
Roman literature includes works by authors such as Virgil, Ovid, and Cicero.
Romans spoke Latin, which is the basis for many modern languages.
Romans wore togas as a symbol of their citizenship.
Romans celebrated the festival of Saturnalia in honor of the god Saturn.
Romans used a calendar that was the precursor to the modern Gregorian calendar.
Romans enjoyed board games and dice games.
Romans enjoyed public spectacles such as gladiator fights and animal hunts.
Roman women could own property and run businesses.
Romans used the Latin phrase 'Carpe diem,' meaning 'Seize the day.'
famous_figures: The Roman Emperor Trajan expanded the empire to its greatest extent.
The Roman Emperor Nero is infamous for his tyrannical rule.
Julius Caesar was a key figure in the transition from the Roman Republic to the Roman Empire.
The Roman Emperor Constantine converted to Christianity.
The Roman Emperor Caligula was known for his eccentric behavior.
The Roman Emperor Augustus established the Pax Romana.
The Roman Emperor Hadrian built Hadrian's Wall in Britain.
The Roman Emperor Diocletian divided the Roman Empire into eastern and western halves.
The Roman Emperor Constantine built the city of Constantinople.
Augustus was the first emperor of Rome.
